If an intervention with function \\( q(x) = e^{Ft}x \\) (where F is another constant matrix) is applied at time \\( t_1 \\), will the state \\( z(T) \\) for T > t_1 depend solely on H and not on D or F?
Explanation: The state at T depends on the interactions among H, D, and F due to their influence on the trajectories of \\( x \\) and \\( z \\). Since \\( q(x) \\) translates to another transformation on \\( z \\) when combined with the effects of D and H, these matrices' properties will collectively determine the final state \\( z(T) \\).
